meanings.definition: To fill with dismay or horror
meanings.sent1: The scary movie appalled the young children.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news appalled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs might appall some, but others find it intriguing.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the abandoned house appalled her, as if it held a dark secret.
meanings.sent5: The stench from the garbage dump was so strong, it could appall even the bravest souls.

meanings.definition: To cause intense fear or shock
meanings.sent1: The sudden thunderstorm appalled the nervous dog.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house stories appalled the group of friends.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a clown jumping out of a cake might appall some, but it would definitely be memorable.
meanings.sent4: The news of the impending storm appalled the coastal town, sending them into a frenzy of preparation.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the forest at night could appall even the most seasoned campers.
